images.place: Tim Ho Wan, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Chinese fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) is cooked rice that has been cooled and then stir-fied with meats and vegetables (often leftovers).

**Eating Tip**

Don't feel obligated to try eating fried rice with chopsticks. In Asia, fried rice is often eaten with a spoon. It's a lot easier!

**Cooking Tip**

It's often advised to use day-old refrigerated rice which has dried out somewhat and won't be a sticky clump like freshly-cooked rice (in fact, fried rice originated as a way to reuse leftover rice).Although Danny Bowien in his [Mission Chinese Food Cookbook](https://www.harpercollins.com/products/the-mission-chinese-food-cookbook-danny-bowienchris-ying?variant=32208106618914) advocates frying freshly-cooked rice.

**Food Safety Tip**

Rice spoils quickly, so don't leave it out at room temperature too long

**Characters**

{炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice* (cooked), so {炒飯} is *stir-fried rice*.

[Fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) mixed with seafood.

**Characters**

{海鮮} is *seafood* ({海} is *ocean* and {鮮} is *fresh*, so *seafood* is *ocean fresh*). {炒飯} is [stir-fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) ({炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice*), so 海鮮炒飯 is *seafood stir-fried rice*.

[Yanghzhou fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yangzhou_fried_rice), often listed as *Yang Chow fried rice* or just the restaurant's *house fried rice* (or in the UK, *special fried rice*), is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) mixed with scrambled egg, shrimp and barbequed pork or Chinese sausage. The ingredients vary, but this dish is distinguished by including multiple meats, whereas most Chinese fried dishes feature a single protein (pork fried rice, chicken fried rice, shrimp fried rice...).

**Trivia**

The city of [Yanghzhou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yangzhou) celebrated their 2500th anniversary (that's right, 2500 years!) by assembling around 300 cooks to prepare over 9000 pounds of their namesake dish in a bid to enter the Guinness World Records as the largest serving of fried rice, but the batch was disqualified as a portion was considered inedible (at least to humans - some of it went to livestock).

**Characters**

{揚州} is Yangzhou, the city in China where this dish originated. {炒飯} is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) ({炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice*), so {揚州炒飯} is *Yangzhou stir-fried rice*.

[Fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) mixed with Chinese sausage.

**Characters**

{臘腸} is *Chinese sausage*, {炒飯} is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) ({炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice*), so 臘腸炒飯 is *Chinese sausage stir-fried rice*.

images.place: Ocha Thai Cuisine, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) mixed with shrimp.

**Characters**

{蝦仁} is *shrimp meat* or *shelled shrimp* ({蝦} is *shrimp*, and {仁} is *kernel*, same as the kernel in *apricot kernel* {杏仁}, so it's *shrimp kernel*), {炒飯} is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) ({炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice*), so 蝦仁炒飯 is *shrimp meat stir-fried rice*.

[Fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) mixed with chunks of [BBQ pork]([Cha siu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Char_siu)), and typically with scrambled eggs and peas. Often listed as “pork fried rice.”

**Characters**

{叉燒} is [BBQ pork](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Char_siu), {炒飯} is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) ({炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice*), so 叉燒炒飯 is *BBQ pork stir-fried rice*.

description:
Also known as [Hokkien fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hokkien_fried_rice), this is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) with scrambled egg, covered with thick gravy typically containing seafood, poultry, mushroom, and vegetables.

**Characters**

福建 is Fujian, a province on the southeast coast of China, {炒飯} is [fried rice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_fried_rice) ({炒} is [stir-fried](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stir_frying), and {飯} is *rice*), so 福建炒飯 is *Fujian stir-fried rice*.
